title: sans serif logo--what company?
content:
There’s a logo I can almost... almost see in my mind’s eye, but can’t quite remember it. The font is a condensed, bold, unicase sans serif, lower- and upper-case all the same x-height, just one word, strong and contemporary. Does this ring a bell for anyone? I’m also remembering that the company name began with “f”—but I could be wrong. Many thanks in advance.

 [‹ Typography & Semiotics](http://web.archive.org/web/20081012141659/http:/www.typophile.com/node/45231 "Go to previous forum topic") [Apple MobileMe Logo - What do you think about it? ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20081012141659/http:/www.typophile.com/node/46331 "Go to next forum topic")
author: harrietg

comments.content:
Funny, something flashed across my mind for an instant when I read your post, but I lost it :)

Something with only four letters, right?

Fuse? No...
